meanings.definition: The study of the flow of matter, especially liquids and gases.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use rheologies to understand how liquids move.
meanings.sent2: The rheologies of water help engineers design efficient irrigation systems.
meanings.sent3: Learning about rheologies can be as fun as watching a river flow.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of rheologies was as smooth as the flow of a gentle stream.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made rheologies come alive by showing videos of flowing lava.

meanings.definition: The behavior of a material in response to applied forces.
meanings.sent1: The rheologies of rubber change when pressure is applied.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the rheologies of metals is crucial in construction.
meanings.sent3: The rheologies of jello can be quite surprising when you shake it.
meanings.sent4: His emotions had the rheologies of a bouncy ball, unpredictable and reactive.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the rheologies of clay in a sculpture that seemed to defy gravity.
